channel.title: Changing The Textures!
channel.description:
Renamed Clients
Open up Texture
Use Ctrl + F to find. Code:
[code] private static int[] method371(int i)[/code]
Just under that to edit textures just change the value of i.
For example: Code:
[code] if(i == 40) { i = 24; //Elven - This Changes Lava to Flowing Water. } [/code]
Normal Clients
Open up Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.
Use Ctrl + F to find. Code:
[code]public static final int[] method371(int i)[/code]
Just under that to edit textures just change the value of i.
For example: Code:
[code]if(i == 40) { i = 24; //Elven - This Changes Lava to Flowing Water. }[/code]
Texture List
50 = Suggests the end of the textures... 49 = Something to do with 48, I assume 48 = Hyroglyphs? 47 = Extremely light wall colour... 46 = Ground in varrock by the fountain 45 = Door 44 = Similar to 43; Darker 43 = Buildings' stone wall 42 = Sold blue, for those flowers in Varrock I believe 41 = Bushes of some sort 40 = lava 39 = Painting of an elf 38 = One of the new Falador textures 37 = Same as 38 36 = Door or floor texture? 35 = New Falador walls 34 = Magic tree stars 33 = Maple tree leaves 32 = Sand maybe? 31 = Another lava overlay 30 = Yew tree overlays 29 = Sort of like fern leaves :\ 28 = ? 27 = Snake skin 26 = Spider webs 25 = Water of some sort, I think 24 = Flowing water 23 = Dark buidling siding (something near Lumbridge I think?) 22 = Wooden floor 21 = Roofing maybe? 20 = Book case 19 = Something with.. holes.. 18 = Sand..or..something? 17 = Water found water 16 = Wooden roof I think. 15 = Looks like an overlay for water? 14 = Portrait of a king 13 = Landscape of mountains 12 = Bars on those jail doors, etc 11 = Runecrafting altar \ mysterious rune texture 10 = Solid blue... 9 = Tree stumps 8 = Tree leaves 7 = Um.. Logs or something? 6 = Red roofing 5 = Really dark wood texture 4 = Elven doors 3 = Wooden flooring 2 = Stone walls (i.e. on Varrock banks, etc) 1 = Water 0 = Door
Credits: Elven Lord
Thank Elven Lord for posting this, I do not take credits. This is just a helpful guide that I have not seen before.

item.title: Changing The Textures!
item.dc:creator: @Mades Mades
item.description:
@Mades wrote:

Renamed Clients

Open up Texture

Use Ctrl + F to find.
Code:

 private static int[] method371(int i)

Just under that to edit textures just change the value of i.

For example:
Code:

if(i == 40) { i = 24; //Elven - This Changes Lava to Flowing Water. }

Normal Clients

Open up Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.

Use Ctrl + F to find.
Code:

public static final int[] method371(int i)

Just under that to edit textures just change the value of i.

For example:
Code:

[code]if(i == 40)
{
    i = 24; //Elven - This Changes Lava to Flowing Water.
}[/code]

Texture List

50 = Suggests the end of the textures…
49 = Something to do with 48, I assume
48 = Hyroglyphs?
47 = Extremely light wall colour…
46 = Ground in varrock by the fountain
45 = Door
44 = Similar to 43; Darker
43 = Buildings’ stone wall
42 = Sold blue, for those flowers in Varrock I believe
41 = Bushes of some sort
40 = lava
39 = Painting of an elf
38 = One of the new Falador textures
37 = Same as 38
36 = Door or floor texture?
35 = New Falador walls
34 = Magic tree stars
33 = Maple tree leaves
32 = Sand maybe?
31 = Another lava overlay
30 = Yew tree overlays
29 = Sort of like fern leaves :
28 = ?
27 = Snake skin
26 = Spider webs
25 = Water of some sort, I think
24 = Flowing water
23 = Dark buidling siding (something near Lumbridge I think?)
22 = Wooden floor
21 = Roofing maybe?
20 = Book case
19 = Something with… holes…
18 = Sand…or…something?
17 = Water found water
16 = Wooden roof I think.
15 = Looks like an overlay for water?
14 = Portrait of a king
13 = Landscape of mountains
12 = Bars on those jail doors, etc
11 = Runecrafting altar \ mysterious rune texture
10 = Solid blue…
9 = Tree stumps
8 = Tree leaves
7 = Um… Logs or something?
6 = Red roofing
5 = Really dark wood texture
4 = Elven doors
3 = Wooden flooring
2 = Stone walls (i.e. on Varrock banks, etc)
1 = Water
0 = Door

Credits: Elven Lord

Thank Elven Lord for posting this, I do not take credits. This is just a helpful guide that I have not seen before.
